intro: Crotalaria villicalyx, commonly known as the silky crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces elliptical pods that contain several seeds, and its roots have a symbiotic relationship with nitrogen-fixing bacteria. Crotalaria villicalyx is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in both wet and dry conditions.
